title: Language Education Standards Development and Dissemination: Comparative Analysis of Linear vs. Modular Learning Designs

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Learners are general citizens with limited mathematical backgrounds but interest in language education standards development. Designed for flexible learning using mobile devices in a BYOD environment.

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three historical developmental stages of language education standards.
Learners can compare key differences between linear and modular instructional designs and analyze the advantages and disadvantages of each approach.
Learners can represent the development process of international standards like the CEFR (Common European Framework of Reference for Languages) using mathematical modeling.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
